definition: soldier/noncommssioned officer (NCO)
(bound form) army/military
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
surname Shi

sentences.english: He 's an army sergeant. He needs a loud voice.
sentences.chinese: 大嗓門，因爲他是個軍士。

sentences.english: The drill sergeant begins by putting the fear of God up every new recruit .
sentences.chinese: 這個教練軍士一開始就給全體新兵一個下馬威。

sentences.english: An Enlisted Soldier's rank can range from Private to Sergeant Major of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 一名募徵兵的軍銜從列兵至總軍士長。
軍士麥考夫是我的傳令兵。
他在戰鬥中指揮過軍士。

sentences.english: You can fade away and the sergeant and I will take over.
sentences.chinese: 你可以離開了，軍士和我會接管的。

sentences.english: Sergeants Swordsmen are professional warriors, drawn from the lower classes.
sentences.chinese: 長劍軍士屬於職業部隊，其成員多來自社會下層平民。

sentences.english: Mounted Sergeants are the lesser armed cavalry that ride in support of the knights.
sentences.chinese: 騎馬軍士裝備較差，是支持騎士作戰的附屬部隊。

sentences.english: The sergeant major barked out the order.
Brad had said he was no longer in the service, but that he had been an air force tech sergeant.
sentences.chinese: 布拉德說他已經退伍，原先是個空軍技術軍士。

sentences.english: The general told his sergeants to advance.

sentences.chinese: 軍士長全身被汗浸溼透了。

sentences.english: The sergeant was content with such a compromise.
sentences.chinese: 軍士爲雙方的妥協感到滿意。

sentences.english: You ready to use that weapon, tech sergeant?
sentences.chinese: 你會用那杆槍了吧，技術軍士？

sentences.english: You are the most experienced non-commissioned officer we have left.
sentences.chinese: 你是我們剩下的最有經驗的軍士。

definition: to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
district magistrate/county magistrate
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
Lintao county in Dingxi 定西[Ding4 xi1], Gansu
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
to be in overall charge/to oversee
equestrian archery/riding and shooting
old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
government treasury
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
